summary: This bill, the First-Time Homebuyer Tax Credit Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a refundable tax credit for first-time homebuyers. The credit equals 10% of the purchase price, capped at $15,000 (reduced for married filing separately). It includes income-based and area-median-purchase-price limitations. It also covers age requirements, definitions, exceptions, recapture rules, and allows for the credit to be transferred to the mortgage lender. The bill specifies election details and provides reporting and payment procedures.
